page.title: 01SURVEY OF AREA
page.content: A rural area to the S of Leominster, dominated by farming and sparsely populated. Villages/hamlets are the same as Domesday: Stoke Prior: W part only including church and new private housing: Ford: small church, golf course: Wharton: lying on A49: Brierley: largest hop farm in W Europe. Communications: main railway line Hereford/Shrewsbury North/South. Main trunk road A49 North/South. Minor roads to villages. Footpaths. Natural features: rivers Little Arrow and Arrow flowing eastwards and joining before confluence with river Lugg flowing southwards. Mostly low lying land but rising to south and east, enclosing the river valleys.
